New Records: Seth Lugo threw seven solid innings, which is his 19th quality start of the season, tied for third most in baseball.
Key Match Events: The Royals were no-hit into the eighth, but knotted it in the ninth before James McArthur allowed a walk-off double to Jose Altuve.
Paul DeJong tied the game at 2 with a two-run homer into the Crawford Boxes off Josh Hader with one out in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals manager Matt Quatraro emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals manager Matt Quatraro praised Seth Lugo's exceptional outing, saying he'spun the ball really well, located. He got his sinker in, [threw] good changeups. He had it all working.'
Paul DeJong reflected on his game-changing home run, saying he was looking for something out over the plate to hit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals nearly stole a victory from the Astros at Minute Maid Park.
Seth Lugo credited his preparation between starts for his performance Friday night, saying he was working on some stuff and trying to make an adjustment to put together more quality innings.
Others: First baseman Vinnie Pasquantino would be out six to eight weeks with a broken thumb.
The Royals resolve to fight wasn't lost despite the tough loss and unfortunate news.
